description: The landscape and buildings of HEHO tell how family, faith, education, and hard work opened a world of opportunity to a child of simple beginnings.
name: Herbert Hoover

sites.description: Start your visit with an introduction to Herbert Hoover and his hometown of West Branch.

information.description:
Allow yourself at least 30 minutes in the Visitor Center, which is open from 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. daily. Multimedia exhibits, which include Herbert Hoover’s original cradle and high chair, tell about his childhood in West Branch and his later involvement in developing the park which commemorates his life. The 12-minute film Adventure and Great Undertakings: Herbert Hoover's Childhood in West Branch is played on request. Children can get started on their activity books to become Junior Rangers. An art gallery interprets the park through the works of artists-in-residence.
Federal Recreational Lands Passes are on sale at the Visitor Center. Books, educational items, and gifts are available for purchase from the Eastern National Bookstore inside the Visitor Center.
information.name: Visiting

information.description: Open daily from 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., except on Thanksgiving Day, December 25, and January 1.
information.name: Hours

sites.name: Visitor Center
sites.name_description: Start your visit with an introduction to Herbert Hoover and his hometown of West Branch.

sites.description: Herbert called his birthplace "physical proof of the unbounded opportunity of American life."

information.description: In the years following his presidency, Herbert and Lou Hoover restored the president's humble birthplace, which he called "physical proof of the unbounded opportunity of American life." The small spaces and dearth of material possession reflect an ethic of thrift, and the cottage's status as a starter home for a young family. Antique furnishings from the mid and late 19th century represent common household items for a simply furnished two room rural home.
information.name: Post Presidency

sites.name: Birthplace Cottage

sites.description: Park’s Visitor Center, served as a soldiers’ barracks (1838-1871), converted to jail and courthouse in 1872.

sites.description: The flagpole (99 ft.) is a reproduction of the original built in 1846. This height allows the flag to be seen for miles.
